info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on NamedValue entity associated with your Azure API Management deployment. API Management policies are a powerful capability of the system that allow the publisher to change the behavior of the API through configuration. Policies are a collection of statements that are executed sequentially on the request or response of an API. Policy statements can be constructed using literal text values, policy expressions, and NamedValues. Each API Management service instance has a NamedValues collection of key/value pairs that are global to the service instance. These NamedValues can be used to manage constant string values across all API configuration and policies.
info.title: ApiManagementClient

get.description: Lists a collection of NamedValues defined within a service instance.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| tags | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith, any, all | </br>| displayName | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>
parameters.name: $filter

parameters.description: Number of records to return.
parameters.name: $top

parameters.description: Number of records to skip.
parameters.name: $skip

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: A Collection of the NamedValue entities for the specified API Management service instance.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

secret.description: Determines whether the value is a secret and should be encrypted or not. Default value is false.

tags.description: Optional tags that when provided can be used to filter the NamedValue list.

displayName.description: Unique name of NamedValue. It may contain only letters, digits, period, dash, and underscore characters.

value.description: Value of the NamedValue. Can contain policy expressions. It may not be empty or consist only of whitespace. This property will not be filled on 'GET' operations! Use '/listSecrets' POST request to get the value.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.
